title: Hans Magnus Enzensberger, Leading Light in German Letters, Dies at 93
description: Poet, essayist, journalist and social critic, he held wide influence among a postwar literary generation with works as intellectual as they were political.

title: Under Pressure, South Africa’s President Snubs Party’s Leadership
description: In the face of possible impeachment, Cyril Ramaphosa has not been seen since the release of a damning report. But his allies are urging him to fight back and remain in office.

title: Pakistan Condemns ‘Assassination Attempt’ on Its Kabul Embassy
description: The gunfire, which critically injured one security guard, comes amid increased tensions between the two countries.

title: Paul Whelan, American Prisoner in Russia, Contacts Family After Weeks of Silence
description: Mr. Whelan is serving a 16-year sentence in Russia on espionage charges that the United States calls politically motivated.

title: Canadian Man Charged in Rebecca Contois's Murder Accused of 3 More Killings
description: The suspect was accused of killing three Indigenous women and another unidentified woman, all of whom had gone missing in Winnipeg.

title: In Call With Putin, Scholz Vows Germany’s Continued Support for Ukraine
description: The call, which the Germany chancellery said lasted an hour, was the first between the two leaders since September.

title: How the ‘Price Cap’ on Russian Oil Works
description: The plan to curb Moscow’s oil revenues relies heavily on European shipping and insurance companies, but experts point to major loopholes.

title: Ukrainian Embassies Targeted With Bloody Packages, Kyiv Says
description: The packages arrived several days after six letter bombs were mailed to offices in Spain, including those of Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez and the American and Ukrainian Embassies.

title: Population Growth Is Making Hurricanes More Expensive
description: The 2022 Atlantic hurricane season, which ended this week, was one of the most destructive on record.

title: Zelensky Wants to Ban Religious Groups with Links to Moscow
description: Ukraine’s president asked for legislation to outlaw religious organizations affiliated with Russia. Kyiv says a Ukrainian Orthodox monastery that was raided last week may have hosted Russian spies.

title: New Zealand and Australia Ponder a Lower Voting Age
description: As today’s teenagers will bear the brunt of tomorrow’s problems, especially climate woes, some lawmakers think 16-year-olds deserve a say at the polls.

title: A Drummer Showing the Way to ‘the Freest Musical Universe’
description: Miguel Tomasín, one of the few professional musicians with Down syndrome, has brought attention to the artistic visions of people with developmental disabilities, with his band releasing over 100 albums.

title: How a German State Helped Russia Complete Nord Stream 2
description: The threat of U.S. sanctions jeopardized completion of a second direct gas pipeline from Russia. So Gazprom and German officials concocted a phony climate foundation to get the job done.

title: How China’s Police Used Phones and Faces to Track Protesters
description: After a weekend of protests, the authorities in China are using the country’s all-seeing surveillance apparatus to find those bold enough to defy them.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: Emmanuel Macron’s state visit to the U.S.

title: As Officials Ease Restrictions, China Faces New Pandemic Risks
description: Huge swaths of the nation’s elderly remain vulnerable, scientists say, and a surge in deaths and hospitalizations may be inevitable.

title: Germans Turn to Heat Pumps to Replace Gas Furnaces
description: The boxy machines look and function like large air-conditioners on reverse, but Germans hope they hold the key to Europe’s push for fossil-free heating.

title: Prosecutor Drops Australia Parliament Rape Case, Citing Toll on Accuser
description: Mental trauma that Brittany Higgins faced from the proceedings presented a “significant and unacceptable risk” to her life, the prosecutor said.

title: Day 2: Your Ugly Christmas Sweater Is Beautiful in Its Own Way
description: The Times’s fashion director casts a discerning eye on this peculiar holiday tradition.

title: ‘Constant’ Russian Airstrikes Stifle Ukraine’s Efforts to Restore Power
description: Even as Ukrainian workers race to restore basic services like electricity, heat and water, new Russian airstrikes send them back to the starting line.

title: ‘Constant’ Russian Airstrikes Stifle Ukraine’s Efforts to Restore Power
description: Even as Ukrainian workers race to restore basic services like electricity, heat and water, new Russian airstrikes send them back to the starting line.
